title: Michael Che called out for misgendering Caitlyn Jenner on 'SNL,' joke deemed 'transphobic'
text:
CLOSE Caitlyn Jenner is putting late night hosts on blast! USA TODAY

Michael Che referred to Caitlyn Jenner as a "fella" during the "Weekend Update" segment on "Saturday Night Live," and Twitter is not happy with the comedian misgendering the former Olympian.

Che started off his bit by saying how Kanye West is transforming into an old white woman.

"I mean, he used to be one of the coolest black dudes on Earth now he’s showing up to events in sweatpants and orthopedic sneakers, listening to Kenny G and trying to get black people to like Trump," Che said. "It’s like, how long before this guy changes his name to Cathy."

On the same note, Che alluded that West's transformation to "an old white lady" was because of his move to Calabasas.

"Now, you might think that I’m crazy, but about five years ago, there was a fella named Bruce Jenner, and he moved to Calabasas," Che said cutting his sentence short.

Jenner came out as transgender in 2015 and began her transition around the same time.

Following the SNL episode, people took to Twitter to air out their anger at Che.

"SNL just made a Caitlyn Jenner joke that was so bad and transphobic that you could hear someone in the audience say 'Noooooo,' " tweeted one user.

SNL just made a Caitlyn Jenner joke that was so bad and transphobic that you could hear someone in the audience say “Noooooo” — Bonnie Stiernberg (@aahrealbonsters) October 27, 2019

Some people didn't like that Che deliberately misgendered Jenner just for a joke.

"Caitlyn Jenner was deadnamed and misgendered as a punchline. There wasn’t even a joke," wrote another Twitter user. "The punchline was just dead naming her and then the bit ended. It was super uncomfortable for the audience."

Caitlyn Jenner was deadnamed and misgendered as a punchline. There wasn’t even a joke. The punchline was just dead naming her and then the bit ended. It was super uncomfortable for the audience. — Jaime Renée Wiz 🌈🦄 (@jairewiz) October 28, 2019

A few people called the SNL cast member's joke "transphobic."

Michael Che about to try out the transphobic joke he was working on all week pic.twitter.com/IffXdKyMRN — Will Long✨ (@Willful_long) October 27, 2019

"I’m disappointed in your comparison of Kanye West, a cis man, to Caitlyn Jenner, a trans woman. Your comparison implies that trans women are just men who change their names," another added.

@nbcsnl Michael Che, I’m disappointed in your comparison of Kanye West, a cis man, to Caitlyn Jenner, a trans woman. Your comparison implies that trans women are just men who change their names. You also misgendered and deadnamed her. (1/2) — Geoffrey 🌻 (@_toastyghost_) October 28, 2019

"Transphobia is not funny and not acceptable in 2019," one user tweeted.e

Just heard about Michael Che deadnaming Caitlyn Jenner last night on SNL. Transphobia is not funny and not acceptable in 2019. Do better, SNL. — Tricia Cave (@tdcave) October 28, 2019

USA TODAY has reached out to reps for Che, West and Jenner for comment.

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/celebrities/2019/10/28/snl-michael-che-misgendering-caitlyn-jenner-weekend-update/2486829001/
description: Michael Che is under fire on Twitter for referring to Caitlyn Jenner as a "fella" on the most recent episode of "Saturday Night Live."
